post.summary: Uploads a file to your endpoint cloud service.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded

get.summary: Retrieves a single file from your cloud service from a specified path. The file is directly streamed from the cloud storage provider through Cloud Elements, and is not buffered to disk.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

delete.summary: Deletes a file from your cloud service by its specified path.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: emptyTrash
parameters.description: Whether or not the file should also be deleted from trash

post.summary: Copies a file specified by a file path to another file path, leaving the original intact. If the source file path does not exist an error response is returned. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created. Copying a file that already exists overwrites the file.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination file. Path is required

get.summary: Returns a link that can be used to download the specified file through Cloud Elements. The link can be used to download the file without providing credentials.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

patch.summary: Update a file's metadata (path) associated with a path.  The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a file as well as move a file by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a file.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the file (e.g. /myDirectory/myFile.txt)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the fields to update. Valid values include path.

get.summary: Retrieves a specific file associated with an ID from your cloud service from a specified path.  The file is directly streamed from the cloud storage provider through Cloud Elements, and is not buffered to disk.

parameters.name: id

post.summary: Creates a new folder on your cloud service using its specified path. Creation of the new folder goes through Cloud Elements. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist they will be created. Creating a folder that already exists results in an error response.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object with the fields to create. Valid values include path

delete.summary: Deletes an entire folder from your cloud service by its specified path. The folder specified is deleted from your cloud service.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: emptyTrash
parameters.description: Whether or not the folder should also be deleted from trash

get.summary: Get a list of CloudFiles that are contained in a specified folder on your cloud service specified by a path.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 50 if not supplied
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

post.summary: Copies a folder specified by a file path to another file path, leaving the original intact. If the source path does not exist an error response is returned. If the destination path includes directories that do not exist, they will be created. Copying a folder that already exists results in the folder being overwritten.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the existing folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination folder. Path is required

patch.summary: Update a folder's metadata (path) associated with its path.  For example, if you had a folder that was located in the operations directory, but needed to be moved into the legal directory, then you would perform a PATCH using the path JSON field to update the path. The PATCH method can update the name or directory path of a folder also by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a folder.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The full path to the existing folder (e.g. /myDirectory)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the field to update. Valid values include path.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A CloudFile object representing the destination folder. Path is required

patch.summary: Update a folder's metadata (path) associated with an ID.  For example, if you had the ID of a folder that was located in the operations directory, but needed to be moved into the legal directory, then you would perform a PATCH using the path JSON field to update the path.  The PATCH method can update the name or directory of a folder also by using the path JSON field. You cannot update the size of a folder.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The folder's folder_id in Egnyte.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A Metadata object with the field to update. Valid values include path.

get.summary: Ping the Element to confirm that the Hub Element has a heartbeat.  If the Element does not have a heartbeat, an error message will be returned.

Performs a text search.  The search uses substring matching so searching for "exam" will match on "example.txt".  Subdirectories are also searched.  The search returns a list of CloudFiles that match search parameters.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text in the file or folder name

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date (based on the created date of the file or folder) if used, start date is required. Date should be of the format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ" (ISO-8601), eg. 2015-01-14T22:19:29Z

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date (based on the created date of the file or folder) if used, end date is required. Date should be of the format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ" (ISO-8601), eg. 2015-01-14T22:19:29Z

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 100 if not supplied
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

summary.x-samplevalue: Create a new contact in the CRM service. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.
